entries.femaleVariant: <kiroshi l="mex" o="Entonces me dice: «Un desayuno, por favor». Y yo le respondo: «Lo siento, pero ya no estamos sirviendo el desayuno»." t="So he goes, \"One breakfast, please,\" and I say, \"Sorry, but we've already stopped serving breakfast.\" " b="" a=""/>

<kiroshi l="mex" o="Que la otra chica, Sheila, ya se lo había dicho. Así que, le dije que lo sentía y se lo repetí: «Ya no estamos sirviendo el desayuno»." t="He said the waitress, Sheila, already told him that. So I said I was sorry and told him again, we've stopped serving breakfast." b="" a=""/>
<kiroshi l="mex" o="Le dije que era política de la empresa y que no podemos hacer excepciones." t="I said it's company policy and we can't make exceptions." b="" a=""/>
Good. That's good. So what then? He whip out his iron?

<kiroshi l="mex" o="Sí, empezó a gritar y decía «El cliente siempre tiene la razón», mientras zarandeaba el arma." t="Yeah, started shouting that, \"The customer's always right\" and waving his piece around." b="" a=""/>
Good thing nobody tried to play the hero. So d'you give him the breakfast in the end?

<kiroshi l="mex" o="No, cambió de opinión. Optó por el almuerzo y se fue. Un ciberpsicópata de pies a cabeza, la verdad." t="No, he changed his mind. Took the lunch and just walked out. Total cyberpsycho, I'm tellin' ya." b="" a=""/>
